intro: Critoniopsis cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and thrives in well-drained soils. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and is known for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
